page.title: 10A Farmers Day.
page.content: Mr and Mrs Jenkinson rise about 7am in time for breakfast at 7.30am.After breakfast Mr Jenkinson checks the live-stock(which at present consists of 31 heifers,7 bullocks,12 ewes and 5 lambs)to make sure that none have strayed from the fields,during the night. When the dew has gone, about 9.15am, he turns his attention to hay_ making.It will take him all day to cut a 10 acre field of hay but he always breaks for dinner at 12.00. When the hay has been cut, the farmer has his own baler to do small bales but hires a contractor to do the large rolls of hay. The hay is then stored in the barn. Mr Jenkinson's busy day ends between 5 or 6.O'clock when he will return to the farmhouse for his evening meal.At about 7.00 he goes and checks on the live-stock again.
